intro: Capparis deckenii, commonly known as the African sour fig, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits. Its fruit is edible and has a sour taste, making it a valued food source in some regions. Capparis deckenii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
